ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basic classical music theory, rhythmic and harmonic transcription and listening skills, singing melodies and rhythms, identifying chords and chord progressions, improvising, and a little bit of dancing
Solfege, harmonic and rhythmic dictation, sight singing, music theory
Aural music skills
Good practice on harmonic and rhythmic dictations as well as sight singing.

I learned how to be able to hear something and write it down, so I guess I was trying to build my "perfect pitch". I also learned about 7 chords and different chords and cadences and such which was something I never knew.

This course really helped me cement my understanding of important music theory concepts such as triads, 7th chords and roman numerals, as well as significantly improving my comfort with sight singing.
Sightreading, sightsinging, chords, inversions, dictation

In MUSI 218, I learned a lot about aural skills, including harmonic dictation, melodic dictation, and sight singing with solfge. I also learned about intervals, inversions, major and minor keys, cadences, seventh chords, melodic ornamentations/nonharmonic tones, antecedent/consequent, suspensions, canons, blues, period vs sentence, hyper meter, and AABA form.
I improved my music sensibility in general, including the ability to identify chords, transcribe melodies and rhythms, and improvise over chord loops.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: The course consistently went at a good pace, where I felt challenged the whole time, but never felt bored or like I was learning things I already knew. Professor Tai was really helpful and supportive throughout the course, and I improved much more as a musician than I expected to before taking this class. Weaknesses: The content could be hard to keep up with if you didn't immediately know what was going on.

Strengths: It was nice that the professor was very willing to listen to our feedback and change the pace of the course with our comfort level on certain topics. I also appreciated that we didn't limit our music theory lessons to just classical music.

Weaknesses: It's hard to learn solfege! I wish we spent more time getting comfortable with that.
great class, definitely helped me with my aural musicianship.

It seems at times a little thrown together because its mostly based in the practice of those skills. The two sections should work together to create a joint curriculum that feels a little more structured and maybe dives deeper into music theory.

I loved the content! It covered a lot of things that I had no idea about as a musician from a low-income, public school background. I will say though that it became a little harder to follow along when we got to chord building and inversions.

I really appreciated the consistency of the homework as it helped me stay on track with my practicing. The in-class group exercises were also really helpful for improving my skill and confidence with sight singing.
Great course, very engaging and fun. Loved the rhythmic and melodic dictation parts of the class.

This course overall has a lot of strengths. Class itself was engaging, with the class engaging in group singing exercises often. My only complaint would be perhaps the pace is a little too slow for those students who have "better ears" coming into the class than other students.
i wish the class materials could be more organised.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I learned a lot of different things that are all useful to me as a musician, and I got the chance to build up my listening and singing skills in a way that would have been hard to do outside of a setting like this.
Yes; take this course, especially if you are a musician!
yes, great class!
Yes, but probably not for someone who is already knowledgeable about music theory.
Yes! Especially if you feel like there's something missing from your music knowledge. It definitely helped my out and I'm a bit more confident in understanding this aspect of music.

I would definitely recommend this course to anyone who is wanting to improve their sight singing and music theory skills. The course allows you to build practicing these skills consistently into your schedule and the structure creates significant improvement over the semester.
This course is great for those who want to learn music singing, sightreading, and dictation. Really fun class!

I would highly recommend this course to any student who wants to improve their aural skills. Aural skills are very important in aspiring musicians, so this course is applicable to a wide variety of musically inclined people.
yes, it was a low-workload, overall chill class to take as a co-requisite for music lessons
yes! it is a super fun class for those who wish to improve their aural skills and music theory knowledge base in an active and engaging way.

extras.title: MUSI 218 02 - Aural Skills for Tonal Music
